descr: "An occurrence of information being transmitted; e.g. an alert that was sent to a responsible provider, a public health agency was notified about a reportable condition."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Communication resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Identifiers associated with this Communication that are defined by business processes and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation)."

fields.name: definition
fields.descr: "A protocol, guideline, or other definition that was adhered to in whole or in part by this communication event."

fields.name: basedOn
fields.descr: "An order, proposal or plan fulfilled in whole or in part by this Communication."

fields.name: partOf
fields.descr: "Part of this action."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The status of the transmission."

fields.name: notDone
fields.descr: "If true, indicates that the described communication event did not actually occur."

fields.name: notDoneReason
fields.descr: "Describes why the communication event did not occur in coded and/or textual form."

fields.name: category
fields.descr: "The type of message conveyed such as alert, notification, reminder, instruction, etc."

fields.name: medium
fields.descr: "A channel that was used for this communication (e.g. email, fax)."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "The patient or group that was the focus of this communication."

fields.name: recipient
fields.descr: "The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, or device) which was the target of the communication. If receipts need to be tracked by individual, a separate resource instance will need to be created for each recipient. Â Multiple recipient communications are intended where either a receipt(s) is not tracked (e.g. a mass mail-out) or is captured in aggregate (all emails confirmed received by a particular time)."

fields.name: topic
fields.descr: "The resources which were responsible for or related to producing this communication."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The encounter within which the communication was sent."

fields.name: sent
fields.descr: "The time when this communication was sent."

fields.name: received
fields.descr: "The time when this communication arrived at the destination."

fields.name: sender
fields.descr: "The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, or device) which was the source of the communication."

fields.name: reasonCode
fields.descr: "The reason or justification for the communication."

fields.name: reasonReference
fields.descr: "Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this communication."

fields.name: payload
fields.descr: "Text, attachment(s), or resource(s) that was communicated to the recipient."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Additional notes or commentary about the communication by the sender, receiver or other interested parties."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."

 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
